places.generalDescription: Hawa Mahal, often referred to as the "Palace of Winds," is a stunning architectural gem located in Jaipur, Rajasthan. Built in 1799 by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh, this five-story palace is renowned for its striking facade adorned with numerous small windows known as jharokhas. These intricately designed openings not only enhance the beauty of the structure but also serve a practical purpose by allowing cool breezes to flow through, making it an early form of natural air conditioning.

sources.snippet: While many people just view Hawa Mahal from the outside, I loved the chance to head inside and look out from the same windows I‚Äôd been looking up at minutes before. While this building is famous for its iconic pink facade, its history is what drew me in.The wives of the maharajas (and in fact many women of the time) weren‚Äôt allowed to be seen in public without their husbands and instead, were hidden away in elaborate buildings such as Hawa Mahal. Here, they lived lives of luxury but weren‚Äôt allowed to mix with the rest of the world.

sources.snippet: One of Jaipur‚Äôs most iconic and distinctive landmarks, the Hawa Mahal was constructed in 1799 by Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh as a way to allow ladies of the royal household to watch life on the streets below without being seen themselves. The five-storey tall honeycomb hive facade consists of 953 latticework windows for the ladies‚Äô viewing pleasure. This famous perspective of the palace is actually on the rear side facing the main road, meaning that getting a shot through the traffic can be tough.

You can stand in front of the Mahal to get the perfect Instagrammable capture and round up your trip to Jaipur, or head to one of the rooftop cafes across the road, which offer one of the best views of the Mahal, and the perfect backdrop to flaunt your outfits!

places.name: Hawa Mahal

reviews.text:
Hawa Mahal, or the ‚ÄúPalace of Winds,‚Äù is one of the most iconic landmarks in Jaipur. Built in 1799, this beautiful five-story palace made of red and pink sandstone is known for its 953 small windows, called jharokhas, designed to let cool air flow through the building.

The front of Hawa Mahal looks like a honeycomb or crown and is especially beautiful in the early morning light. Many people love taking photos from across the street, where several rooftop caf√©s offer the best views. From there, you can capture the full front of the palace-but please note, most caf√©s only allow photography if you buy something, like a cup of coffee or a snack. It's a small price for a great experience and view.

Hawa Mahal was originally built so royal women could watch street life and festivals without being seen. Today, you can go inside and walk up the narrow ramps to enjoy beautiful views of the old city and nearby landmarks like Jantar Mantar.

Inside the palace, there are breezy passages, quiet courtyards, and a small museum. It doesn't take much time to visit, but it's full of charm and history.

Please also remember not to write or scratch on the walls. It's a historic site, and we should help protect its beauty.

Hawa Mahal is a must-see in Jaipur-perfect for photography, culture, and a quick coffee with a royal view.

If something in you remembers old stories, quiet dreams, or the simple joy of standing somewhere that has seen centuries pass-Hawa Mahal is made for you. It's not just a monument; it's a breath, a glimpse into royal lives, and a haven of artistry.
I'd recommend going early-beat the heat, catch the gentle light, and let yourself be still for a moment. Let the wind, the pink walls, and the stairs carry you a little away from today and into something tender and timeless.

The experience of being inside the palace was equally enriching. Navigating the winding ramps and staircases, I was able to appreciate the intricate details of the architecture up close. The views of the city from the upper floors are breathtaking, offering a panoramic perspective of Jaipur's vibrant streets and surrounding hills. It's a place that perfectly blends historical significance with stunning beauty. Whether you're a history buff, an architecture enthusiast, or simply looking for a glimpse into India's rich heritage, the Hawa Mahal is an absolute must-visit. It's an unforgettable experience that truly embodies the spirit of Jaipur.

places.address: Hawa Mahal Rd, Badi Choupad, J.D.A. Market, Pink City, Jaipur, Rajasthan 302002, India

places.generalDescription: Amber Palace, also known as Amer Fort, is a stunning architectural marvel located in Jaipur, Rajasthan. This magnificent fort showcases a blend of Hindu and Muslim design elements, making it a unique cultural landmark. Visitors can enjoy elephant rides that add to the enchanting experience of exploring this historical site. The fort's intricate structures are built from various colored stones‚Äîmilk white, light yellow, rose red, and pure white‚Äîwhich give it an amber-like appearance from afar.

sources.snippet: Discover enchanting photo opportunities at Amber Fort, Jaipur's historical gem. Begin your visual journey by capturing the fort's grandeur against the dramatic backdrop of the Aravalli Hills. Explore the ornate details of the Sheesh Mahal, where intricate mirrored mosaics create a celestial atmosphere.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Locations For Photo Shoot in Jaipur 2024

places.name: Amber Palace

reviews.text:
Visiting Amber Fort was truly a memorable experience! I highly recommend going early in the morning ‚Äì the temperature is pleasant, and the crowd is minimal, making it perfect to explore the fort peacefully and click great photos without much disturbance.

A small tip: do not book a jeep to reach the fort entrance. It's completely unnecessary. The walk uphill is hardly 200-300 meters and very manageable, even in casual footwear.

Hiring a guide is a must if you want to understand the rich history and architectural details of the fort. The official guide charges are ‚Çπ400 for a group of 1-4 people and ‚Çπ600 for a group of 6-14. It's definitely worth it for the added insight.

One important caution: avoid buying souvenirs from the shops inside the fort. They are extremely overpriced ‚Äì you can find the same items outside the fort or in the local markets for 4-5 times cheaper.

Overall, Amber Fort is stunning and offers a great start to your Jaipur trip if you plan wisely!

Amber Fort is one of those places that leaves you awestruck the moment you see it........Huge, majestic, and full of history, it easily takes 2‚Äì3 hours to explore........though you'll hardly notice the time passing. The Sheesh Mahal is simply magical........the tiny mirrors sparkle beautifully, even in the faintest light.
I'd highly recommend taking a local guide........they share fascinating stories, little-known facts, and bring the fort's past to life in a way that signboards never can. The architecture is stunning........with a perfect blend of Rajput charm and Mughal elegance, and the views of Maota Lake from the top are picture-perfect.
If you can........arrive early to enjoy the elephant ride up to the fort........it's a unique, royal touch to the experience. For a different vibe........there's also a light and sound show in the evening that tells the fort's history beautifully.
Amber Fort isn't just a sightseeing spot........it's a walk through Rajasthan's glorious past........and honestly........it's one of Jaipur's must-visits.

This palace is a great example of Rajput architecture. You can easily access this place by road and there is lots of parking available. As it is on a hilly area so you have to climb the stairs and walk a little to reach the fort. Once you are inside the fort you are mesmerized by its beauty and the wonderful designs. There is a lake also which adds extra layer to the beauty of this palace. Must visit place whenever you are in Jaipur.

places.generalDescription: Nahargarh Fort, built in 1734 above Jaipur, is part of a trio of forts along with Jaigarh and Amer. It was constructed to protect the city and has a rich military history. The fort also houses a wax museum featuring sports stars, freedom fighters, and Bollywood celebrities. Visitors can embark on a cycling expedition to explore the fort in a unique way while enjoying stunning views of Jaipur and Man Sagar Lake.

sources.snippet: Being the highest point in the city, Nahargarh Fort is really the best place to watch the sun set over Jaipur. Regardless of how many pictures are posted in which Instagrammers can be seen walking on the fort walls, I want to be honest and let you know that the drop on the other side of the walls is actually scary in real life, at least for me it is. Instead, you can just find a good seat at Padao caf√© and watch the sun set over Jaipur.
sources.shortName: A Local's Guide To Best Instagrammable Spots In Jaipur

sources.snippet: Built in 1734, Nahargarh Fort stands high above the northern limits of Jaipur, casting an imposing shadow over the city. The fort was originally named Sudarshangarh, but it became known as Nahargarh, which means ‚Äòabode of tigers‚Äô. Local legend says that the fort was named for Nahar Singh, a dead prince whose spirit was thought to be disrupting construction only sated once a temple was built within the grounds.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Spots in Jaipur, Rajasthan

sources.snippet: This wasn‚Äôt my favourite excursion in Jaipur because I felt the 200 rupee entrance fee was expensive since there wasn‚Äôt much to see inside the fort, plus they wanted an extra 200 for the sunset viewpoint. Despite this, you can‚Äôt deny that Nahargarh Fort is one of the most Instagrammable places in Jaipur. You get a panoramic view of the whole city, all the way out to the mountains on the horizon.
sources.shortName: 12 Instagrammable Places in Jaipur To Take Photos ‚Äì Where Goes Rose?

sources.snippet: Usually combined with visits to the Amber Fort and Panna Meena Ka Kund Stepwell, the views from Nahargarh Fort are one of the big reasons to visit. You can literally wander all the hallways and ramparts all day long if you wanted to. But to maximize your visit, at least check out the meandering rampart fort walls around sunset which will afford you some grand views of Jaipur.
sources.shortName: Jaipur Most Instagrammable and Photogenic Spots

sources.snippet: Whether you‚Äôre looking for pretty gates, city views or the old-time structures, Nahargarh Fort has them all ‚Äì and then some more. The fort sits atop a hill and offers some of the best views of the Pink City below. What‚Äôs more, its various rooms, mahals, terrace structures and more are the perfect way to round up tour Jaipur tour with the most Instagram-worthy shots.

sources.snippet: Nahargarh Fort, situated on the outskirts of Jaipur, is known for breathtaking views of the city and for its extended wall that connects it to Jaigarh Fort. Embellished with delicate carvings and stonework, the Nahargarh Fort is an impregnable structure and together with its two neighbouring forts - Amer and Jaigarh once stood as the strong defence of Jaipur city.

places.name: Nahargarh Fort

reviews.text: Nahargarh Fort is one of the best places to visit in Jaipur especially if you enjoy nature and views. The fort is easily reachable by bike with a smooth road and a short ride through scenic hills. The views from the top are just stunning especially during sunset when you can see the whole city of Jaipur. The fort itself has beautiful old architecture and a peaceful vibe. There are a few cafes inside to relax and enjoy snacks. The area is clean and well maintained

A must visit place in Jaipur. You can drive your car up to the top of the hill to reach this fort. Road in good but in the end very narrow. Parking is available near fort. From roof top of this fort, you get best view of entire Jaipur city. Amazing place.

Visited Nahargarh Fort recently and had a great time. The entry ticket is very reasonably priced at just ‚Çπ52 per person. The fort is open from 9:00 AM to 9:30 PM, giving you plenty of time to explore at your own pace.

We booked our own bike to get there - cost about ‚Çπ50 for parking, which is also fair considering the location and security.

The views from the top are absolutely stunning, especially during sunset. The fort itself is well-maintained and offers a mix of history, architecture, and panoramic city views. Definitely worth a visit if you're in Jaipur!

Would recommend bringing water and wearing comfortable shoes, especially if you plan to walk around a lot. Overall, a memorable and budget-friendly experience. üëç

places.generalDescription: Nestled within the lush surroundings of Ram Niwas Bagh, the Albert Hall Museum stands as a testament to Jaipur's rich heritage and artistic legacy. Established in 1887, this elegant museum is not only the oldest in the city but also an architectural marvel designed by Sir Samuel Swinton Jacob. The Indo-Saracenic style building, crafted from sandstone and marble, beautifully blends Indian and Victorian influences.

sources.snippet: Albert Hall Museum was the first place we visited in Jaipur on the Palace on Wheels itinerary: what a way to start the trip!. The light in the morning was perfect, the pigeons flew into our pictures every couple of minutes and it was the perfect appetizer of what our time in Jaipur would look like and what we expected in Rajasthan: pure beauty!. Although my photo is taken in front of the museum, I think it‚Äôs way easier to capture the hundreds of pigeons from the outside.
sources.shortName: Instagram spots in Jaipur ‚Äì Diana Miaus

sources.snippet: Situated in the Ram Niwas Garden of Jaipur, the Albert Hall Museum is the oldest museum in Rajasthan. Built in 1876, it was initially envisioned to be a concert hall and resembles the architecture of the Victoria and Albert Hall Museum in London, hence, the name. It is a standing example of the Indo-Saracenic architecture and is also known as Government Central Museum.
sources.shortName: 52 Best Places to visit in Jaipur | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: I am sure that most of us have wondered about people using Photoshop to add birds into their pictures, haven‚Äôt we?. Well, you do not have to spend hours editing when you are visiting Albert Hall Museum in Jaipur. Located in Ram Niwas garden, this museum is home to many pigeons that enjoy making a special appearance in your photos in exchange for some grains.

places.name: Albert Hall Museum

reviews.text: Visited the Albert Hall Museum during the day and was truly impressed! The architecture is stunning - a grand, beautifully detailed building that stands out in the heart of Jaipur. Inside, the museum is full of ancient treasures: intricate stone carvings, traditional paintings, royal weapons, textiles, coins, and many fascinating items once used by kings. It's like stepping back in time. Everything is well-organized and informative. Even though I visited in the daytime, the museum was still full of charm and elegance. Highly recommend spending 1‚Äì2 hours here if you're in Jaipur!

The Albert Hall Museum is a gem of Jaipur: rich in history, art, and architectural beauty. It's deserving of a visit-especially during cooler seasons or evening hours-though its surroundings and peak crowd times warrant some planning. Here's to a visit that leaves you inspired!

Albert Hall Museum is truly amazing! I really enjoyed my visit here - it's one of the best places in Jaipur. The museum is well-maintained, beautifully designed, and full of history. Every section has something unique to offer, from ancient artifacts to cultural displays. A perfect place for history lovers and anyone who wants to explore Jaipur's rich heritage. Highly recommended!

places.generalDescription: The City Palace in Jaipur is an opulent 18th-century palace that once served as the residence of Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II and is now a museum. It's a popular historical attraction known for its beautiful collection of paintings, textile gallery, armory, Durbar hall, BaggiKhana, and SarvatoBhadraor (Diwan E-Khas) with exquisite architectural beauty.

sources.snippet: Still owned by the Jaipur royal family, this architectural gem is a lovely mixture of intricate doorways, manicured gardens, and bursts of color that will dazzle your senses. Diwan-I-Khas is the brick red building lined with arches and was used as a private audience hall for royal guests. Continuing onwards, make sure you continue to the inner courtyard (Pritam Niwas Chowk) where there are four doorways that are elaborately decorated with the four season in mind.
sources.shortName: Jaipur Most Instagrammable and Photogenic Spots

sources.snippet: Jawahar Circle Garden is another location that has become Instafamous as of late. It seems that every one that is anyone in the blogosphere just has to capture an image of themselves nonchalantly frolicking through its brightly coloured archway and concourse in a billowing dress and floppy-rimmed hat. Believe it or not, this isn‚Äôt an opulent palace, tomb, or one of Rajasthan‚Äôs many magnificent forts but the inside of Jawahar Circle Garden‚Äôs entrance gate.

sources.snippet: Located in the centre of Jaipur, The City Palace is the present day home of the Royal Family of Jaipur and is an absolute must see on my list. The four seasonal gates and the pink courtyard of the City Palace are known to Instagrammers across the globe. But, in my opinion, the best part about the entire place is actually the blue room called Sukh Niwas that is hidden in a private part of the palace which could be visited for an extra 2500 Rupees.

sources.snippet: After the Hawa Mahal, the Jaipur City Palace doors are the most iconic photo spot in Jaipur. This is one of the top tourist attractions in Jaipur, so be sure to visit first thing in the morning when they open, and head straight to the doors in the back courtyard.

sources.snippet: ## City Palace Jaipur City Palace Jaipur, also known as Amber Fort, is a royal residence in Jaipur. It is one of the largest palace complexes in the world and has been declared as a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1987. The palace complex was built by Maharajas of Jaipur between 1528-1843 AD with an area of over 30000 square meters (32 hectares).

üõï Khole Ke Hanuman Ji Temple, Jaipur ‚Äì A Divine Retreat in the Aravallis
Khole Ke Hanuman Ji is one of the most revered and scenic temples in Jaipur, dedicated to Lord Hanuman. Nestled in the lush green Aravalli hills, the temple offers not only spiritual peace but also breathtaking panoramic views of Jaipur city.
________________________________________
üìç Location & Accessibility
‚Ä¢	Situated around 6‚Äì7 km from Jaipur city center (near Ghat Ki Guni tunnel on Delhi bypass).
‚Ä¢	Well-connected by road, autos, and taxis.
‚Ä¢	Vehicles can go almost up to the top; ample parking space is available.
‚Ä¢	A bit of walking or climbing stairs is required to reach the main sanctum if you're exploring on foot.
________________________________________
üåü Temple Highlights
‚Ä¢	Presiding Deity: Lord Hanuman, worshipped in a powerful and unique form.
‚Ä¢	The idol is believed to be swayambhu (self-manifested), and the place holds deep mythological and spiritual significance.
‚Ä¢	The temple complex includes other shrines too (Ram, Sita, Shiv, etc.) and a goshala (cow shelter).
‚Ä¢	Beautiful Rajasthani architecture with red sandstone, arches, and traditional carvings.
‚Ä¢	The temple also organizes daily aarti and special events on Tuesdays and Saturdays, which are considered auspicious for Hanuman devotees.
________________________________________
üßò Spiritual Experience
‚Ä¢	Peaceful and clean environment-perfect for meditation, prayer, or a calm retreat from city life.
‚Ä¢	Surrounded by hills and trees, you truly feel close to nature and the divine.
‚Ä¢	Devotees often report a powerful energy at the temple and a sense of inner calm after visiting.
________________________________________
ü•ó Prasadam & Facilities
‚Ä¢	The temple is known for offering free prasad, especially during special days.
‚Ä¢	Food counters offer satvik meals at affordable rates.
‚Ä¢	There's a clean seating/dining hall for pilgrims.
‚Ä¢	Drinking water and well-maintained washrooms are available.
‚Ä¢	The place is senior citizen and family-friendly with resting spots and shaded areas.
________________________________________
üì∏ Photography & Views
‚Ä¢	From the top, you get stunning views of Jaipur city and the surrounding hills.
‚Ä¢	The temple's elevated location makes it a great spot for sunrise and sunset views.
‚Ä¢	Ideal for both spiritual seekers and casual tourists looking for peaceful scenery.
________________________________________
‚úÖ Summary Tips
‚Ä¢	üïò Best time to visit: Early morning or late evening for aarti and cooler weather.
‚Ä¢	üë´ Who should visit: Devotees, families, tourists, spiritual seekers.
‚Ä¢	üëü Footwear: Remove shoes before entering the temple area.
‚Ä¢	üì∑ Carry your camera or phone for great landscape and temple shots.
________________________________________
‚ö†Ô∏è Areas to Improve
‚Ä¢	During festivals or Tuesdays, the temple can get very crowded-expect longer waiting time.
‚Ä¢	Signage could be improved for first-time visitors.
‚Ä¢	More shaded rest areas could help, especially in summer months.
________________________________________
üí¨ Final Verdict
Khole Ke Hanuman Ji is more than just a temple-it's an experience of faith, nature, and peace. Whether you're visiting for spiritual reasons or just to explore Jaipur's hidden gems, this hilltop temple is a must-visit for its serenity, cleanliness, and panoramic beauty. It truly captures the spiritual heartbeat of Jaipur.

places.generalDescription: Jantar Mantar in Jaipur is a fascinating 18th-century heritage site that stands as a testament to the astronomical prowess of its creator, Maharaj Sawai Jai Singh II. This remarkable observatory, constructed in 1726 from masonry, marble, and brass, features an array of fixed instruments known as yantras. These large-scale structures resemble abstract sculptures but serve a serious purpose: they accurately measure celestial phenomena such as timekeeping, star locations, planetary angles, and even predict eclipses.

sources.snippet: Located near the City Palace in the regal city of Jaipur, Jantar Mantar is the largest stone astronomical observatory in the world. Owing to its rich cultural, heritage and scientific value, Jantar Mantar in Jaipur has also been featured on UNESCO's list of World Heritage Sites. This ancient study boasts of nineteen instruments built out of stone and brass and was built by Raja Sawai Jai Singh in 1727-33.

My visit to the Jantar Mantar observatory in Jaipur was scheduled for a public holiday, and as expected, the place was bustling with a huge number of tourists.

One of the highlights of my visit was a short, ten-minute introductory video that was shown inside. It provided a concise and fascinating explanation of the history and purpose. It was a great way to understand the complex design of the instruments and the genius of Maharaja.

Jantar Mantar isn't just a monument-it's a living classroom and a sculptural wonder. Perfect for history buffs, science enthusiasts, photographers, or anyone curious about how ancient minds blended function and form. Whether you walk through it under the sun or catch the evening show, it's a standout experience that captures the cosmic curiosity of Jaipur.

Explore The Museum

The opulent monument houses a museum curled up at the left of Awami Darwaza, which allows you to get insights into the lives of the Royal families and warriors. The museum exhibits pictures of the Royal family, stamps, hand-drawn designs of the palace made by the architects of that time, and many other artifacts.

Ancient Temples

Explore some of the ancient temples at the fort, the Ram Harihar Temple of the 10th century and the Kal Bhairav Temple of the 12th century.

Other Tourist Attractions

Some of the other noteworthy architectures are Diwan-i-Aam, Shubhat Niwas, and the Diya Burj, which is the highest point of the fort.

I visited Jaigarh Fort recently and really enjoyed it. The fort is huge and gives a great view of the surrounding area. One of the main attractions is the world's biggest cannon on wheels, called "Jaivana Cannon." It's really amazing to see such a massive cannon from so many years ago. The fort feels strong and simple compared to some other forts, but it has its own charm. If you like history and great views, Jaigarh Fort is definitely worth a visit.

Jaigarh Fort is a must-visit in Jaipur for its grand architecture, stunning views of the Aravalli hills, and rich history. The fort is well-preserved, and the world's largest cannon on wheels is truly impressive. Walking along the massive walls feels like stepping back in time. A perfect spot for history lovers and photographers alike!

places.generalDescription: Perched on a hill in the Aravalli Range, Amer Fort is an impressive 16th-century fortress and palace located near Jaipur, India. Constructed from marble and red sandstone, this grand structure features four levels, intricate gates, cobbled paths, expansive ramparts, courtyards, a temple, and a 12-kilometer surrounding wall. Notably, it boasts an underground passageway connecting it to Jiagarh Fort for royal family escape during wartime.

sources.snippet: Amer Fort is a beautiful fort located 20 minutes outside of the core of Jaipur. places.generalDescription: Amber Fort View offers a stunning perspective of Jaipur, showcasing the impressive blend of Mughal and Rajput architecture. The fort, constructed in 1592 by Raja Man Singh, boasts elaborately mirrored rooms like Diwan-Aam and Sheesh Mahal, narrating tales of grandeur and bravery. While the climb to reach this vantage point may be challenging for beginners due to numerous stairs, the breathtaking views from the top make it a memorable experience.

sources.snippet: The Amber Fort is not only Jaipur‚Äôs most popular tourist attraction, it is also one of the most magnificent buildings in all of Rajasthan. Built with pink and yellow sandstone then embellished with white marble floors and walls, it is infinitely photogenic, especially as the sun fades on an evening, giving the whole fortress an orange and pink hue. The best photographs can be taken from the winding road up to the main entrance and from Jaleb Chowk (Main Courtyard) where you can pose in front of the imposing silver doors on the staircase leading to the main palace.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Spots in Jaipur, Rajasthan

sources.snippet: The most popular destination for both locals and tourists alike, the Amber Fort is a must see for it‚Äôs wide range of architecture, history, and epic views overlooking the city. reviews.text:
Amer fort is one of the must go places in Jaipur.It's a huge fort. Carry govt Id card for taking ticket. Guide charges 400rs,better to take one as the give us a tour of the place and also take photos of us. Takes approx 2-3 hrs for site seeing. Have to take entry tickets. Take ‚òî for scorching heat.
They offer elephant ride here.

Nice place, Amer is named for its 16th-century fort, a dramatic hilltop stronghold overlooking Jaipur. Often called the Amber Palace, the fort features a hall with intricate mirror mosaics and a Ganesh icon carved from coral. Nearby landmarks include the geometric Panna Meena ka Kund stepwell and Jagat Shiromani, a Hindu temple with a striking statue of goddess Kali.

A must visit if you are in Jaipur!  A fort with a lot of history. Divided into 6 sections, each with its own gate and courtyard. The courtyards are stunning and the grounds are very clean. Cool tunnels to go up and lookout, and tunnels that lead to other forts (which are prohibited). We took the elephant ride up to the top, which was not the most comfortable ride but I feel like one has to do it. What's really annoying, and unenjoyable is the constant hawkers. They start when you arrive, while you get on the elephant, and the ENTIRE trip up to the top-not taking NO for an answer!  Once at the top, we tipped our mahout and apparently that was not good enough for him-even tho a big sign said ‚Äúno tipping‚Äù.  Stay away and say no to the photographers, they hounded us from the exit all the way to our car and even in our car!! We even had one show up the the restaurant when we walked out-simply RIDICULOUS!  All in all, the fort is beautiful and spacious and clean, it was the extraneous bits that were extremely annoying!
